irobots

Class Global

  • java.lang.Object
    • irobots.Global

  • public class Global
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains global constants and references to sensors and motors.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The camera sensor at the front of the robot.

    • Field Detail

      • camera

        public static Camera camera
        The camera sensor at the front of the robot.

      • navigator

        public static lejos.robotics.navigation.Navigator navigator
        The navigator controls the robots movement. It can be used to navigate to a certain position. The navigator also holds a robot to the differential pilot which can be used to start certain movements. Controlling the motors should only be done through the navigator or the pilot, otherwise the position calculation will not work.

      • color

        public static ColorSensor color
        The robots color sensor.

      • compass

        public static CompassSensor compass
        The robots compass sensor.

      • robots

        public static Robot[] robots
        This array holds the data about the other robots which has been received. The index in the array corresponds to the id of the other robot. If no information about the robot has been received the entry in the array equals to null.

      • posKoord

        public static PositionCoordinator posKoord
        The position coordinator is responsible for sending the robots position and to update the Robots data in Robot.me

      • comm

        public static CommunicationManager comm
        The communication manager handles the communication between the robots. It is also responsible for receiving the other robots positions.

      • id

        public static int id
        The robots unique id.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Global

        public Global()

    • Method Detail

      • initGlobals

        public static void initGlobals()
        Initialize the Global constants. This method should be called once during the program initialization and initializes all the sensors and communication. If the robot has no robot id defined the user is prompted to set the id of the robot when this method is called.
